bug.author: lighteternal
bug.summary: Stuck on " HTTP request sent; waiting for response. " terminal screen after running any streamlit script
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
I had been using streamlit without issues for a couple of months. Suddenly, when I try to launch any app (even streamlit hello), a new screen (lynx-like) appears on the terminal, with the following message: HTTP request sent; waiting for response. The app is not accessible via network (it's on a remote server so I can't test locally). <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
What are the steps we should take to reproduce the bug:
Set up a clean environment and install streamlit dependencies Run streamlit hello
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
I should be able to access the running app via network. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
The following screen pops up and the app is not accessible via network. <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22905968/96579028-d3c6e880-12de-11eb-8c7d-bcba0c23c3bb.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: Streamlit, version 0.65.0 Python version: Python 3.6.9 Using Conda? PipEnv? PyEnv? Pex? Pip OS version: Ubuntu 18.04 Browser version: Any
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
I also attach the output I get from the terminal right after running the hello app (the lynx-like screen shown above pops up right after, but I can see the logs as soon as I Ctrl+C. Everything looks fine I think: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22905968/96579741-07564280-12e0-11eb-92ba-bfac04a2184f.png></denchmark-link>
Moreover, while the app is running, the browser seems to be in a waiting stage forever, but as soon as I kill it I get the This site canâ€™t be reached screen appears I have already tested:
different streamlit versions server reboot different virtual envs checking connectivity by setting a simple HTTP server different ports But nothing has solved this issue.
Edit: Weirdly enough, when I run the "hello" or any other app, the command reports the following processes: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22905968/96601056-4d200480-12fa-11eb-8a6f-771ec30100b3.png></denchmark-link>
Should the third one be there?

comments.comment:
Found the root of the problem. For anyone having this issue on a remote machine: On your terminal, create a config file with: streamlit config show > ~/.streamlit/config.toml Then, go to the .toml file and change the headless argument to true: <denchmark-code># If false, will attempt to open a browser window on start. # Default: false unless (1) we are on a Linux box where DISPLAY is unset, or (2) server.liveSave is set. headless = true </denchmark-code>
Closing this issue.
